subject: Web3
title: Renewable Energy Certificates
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Renewable Energy Certificates.

hook.text: When you pay for 'green energy,' how do you know it's real? Renewable energy certificates are often opaque.

buildup.text: RECs prove that energy was generated from renewable sources. But paper-based systems allow fraud and double-selling.

discovery.text: Blockchain-based RECs are unique tokens tied to specific energy generation events. They can't be duplicated or forged.

twist.text: Energy Web Foundation built a blockchain specifically for the energy sector. Major utilities are already using it.

climax.text: Transparent green energy tracking builds real consumer trust. When you buy green, blockchain can prove it's green.

punchline.text: Blockchain proves your green energy is actually green.

quiz.question: How do blockchain-based renewable energy certificates improve trust?
options: They create unique, unforgeable tokens tied to specific generation events
